00064 #include "nut_io.h"
00065 
00066 #include <errno.h>
00067 #include <sys/device.h>
00068 #include <sys/nutdebug.h>
00069 
00074 
00075 
00094 int _open(CONST char *name, int mode)
00095 {
00096     NUTDEVICE *dev;
00097     char dev_name[9];
00098     uint_fast8_t nidx;
00099     CONST char *nptr = name;
00100 
00101     NUTASSERT(name != NULL);
00102 
00103     /*
00104      * Extract device name.
00105      */
00106     for (nidx = 0; *nptr && *nptr != ':' && nidx < 8; nidx++) {
00107         dev_name[nidx] = *nptr++;
00108     }
00109     dev_name[nidx] = 0;
00110 
00111     /*
00112      * Get device structure of registered device. In later releases we
00113      * try to open a file on a root device.
00114      */
00115     if ((dev = NutDeviceLookup(dev_name)) == 0) {
00116         errno = ENOENT;
00117         return -1;
00118     }
00119 
00120     /*
00121      * We should check, if the mode flags are device conformant.
00122      */
00123 
00124     /*
00125      * If a device name was specified, open this device. Otherwise open
00126      * a file on the device.
00127      */
00128     if (*nptr++ != ':')
00129         nptr = 0;
00130     return (int) ((uintptr_t) ((*dev->dev_open) (dev, nptr, mode, 0)));
00131 }
